str:Codelist.com:Name: Consumer Price Index (CPI) Type of Transformation

str:Code.com:Name: Index
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, Period-over-period percent change
str:Code.com:Description: Average percentage change of the data series over a defined period. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.

str:Code.com:Name: Period average, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
str:Code.com:Description: The percentage change over two consecutive years in the average value of an index for the current period compared to the previous period. This provides a measure of how the average relative value (compared to the base period) has changed over two consecutive periods. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.

str:Code.com:Name: Weight
str:Code.com:Description: Weight refers to a numerical value assigned to each observation in a dataset to adjust its relative importance in calculations.

str:Code.com:Name: Weight, Percent
str:Code.com:Description: Weight refers to a numerical value assigned to each observation in a dataset to adjust its relative importance in calculations. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.

str:Code.com:Name: Overlap, Index
str:Code.com:Description: This refers to a period where existing and new series (e.g., Consumer Price Index) are compiled in parallel to allow the two to be linked. It's a methodological construct to facilitate linking and ensure a smooth transition between different versions or methodologies of data collection. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time.

str:Code.com:Name: Standard reference period (SRP), Index
str:Code.com:Description: Standard Reference Period (SRP) is a consistent timeframe used for comparing data over time. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time.
